intro: Primulina carinata, commonly known as the ridge-leaf gloxinia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves with a prominent central ridge. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, typically blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistently moist, well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
